title: Has riot even given an answer over how to handle afks in ranked?
body: It feels as if this issue is not even a concern anymore.

replies.body: what are you talking about? They made Remake for afks specifically

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1iXymN1,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-02-25T17:22:44.567+0000)
>
> what are you talking about? They made Remake for afks specifically

I mean minus the start of the match. In terms of the whole match over all it feels like such a short window. Couldn't the remade function be allowed for the whole match to fix that issue? Or am I missing something? Feel free to teach me if so I need to know more on this anyway XD.

If you could remake at any point in the game so long as there was an afk, it'd be to easy to abuse if it looked like you were gonna lose. It wouldn't be fair to the winning team if someone on the enemy team went afk and took the lp hit to prevent anyone else from winning/losing lp.

By only making remake for the first 3mins, it stops that abuse while still giving teams who never had their 5th member a reasonable excuse to remake.

> [{quoted}](name=Slythion,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=i1iXymN1,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-02-26T05:21:41.102+0000)
>
> If you could remake at any point in the game so long as there was an afk, it'd be to easy to abuse if it looked like you were gonna lose. It wouldn't be fair to the winning team if someone on the enemy team went afk and took the lp hit to prevent anyone else from winning/losing lp.
> 
> By only making remake for the first 3mins, it stops that abuse while still giving teams who never had their 5th member a reasonable excuse to remake.

I mean of course the other team would get a win that would be dumb to just negate the whole match. But what I am getting at is people can't full on abuse that afk trick for long as after a number of afks they just can't flat out keep spamming for the next que.

at this point we'd be arguing about tiny details or semantics like: 

"how *much* should we give the enemy team if someone decides to leave a losing game"
"should length of the game determine ratio of lp win/loss?"
"how fair is it to the winning team to recieve less ip, do they really care that the abuser lost more lp? It doesn't really help the winning team"
 etc etc

when we start determining whether it's worth it or not to implement this complicated system based on these semantics, it's no longer worth Riot's time or money just to implement a controversial system that really only benefits people a little bit.

I think the op means people who afk after the remake time limit. 

They could make those individuals lose double the LP and make their team lose half of it, in solo q at least. Something along those lines. In order to make this not exploitable by smurfs they could also bar people from queuing ranked for several days after afking.

The worry is that it'll cause situations where people will try to get their allies to AFK when things look bad so they don't have to take the full penalty. Someone decides to DDOS you and suddenly you loose twice as much LP as they did. Does that sound fair to you?
Yeah it's not about those two doing anything. It's about one of those two boosting the other one

If they make the remake option available the whole match there would be almost nothing stopping duos from afking one person to save the other's LP

> If they make the remake option available the whole match there would be almost nothing stopping duos from afking one person to save the other's LP

I feel as if that would only be an issue for a short time though as those two would not make much progress over all.

DDOS is EXTREMELY rare in league. That's not a viable example, especially for any rank below the top 1%.

And yes, but the team would still lose LP, and their ally would receive a double loss on top of a several day ban. I feel like this would deter most people out of pure selfishness. 

It was just a suggestion anyways, obviously I'm no game designer.
What are they going to do? Bind people to their chairs and make them play
